PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY:

· Over 3.11 years  of programming experience as an Oracle SQL,PL/SQL Developer in Analysis, Design, Data Modeling (Logical and Physical) and Implementation of Business Applications using the Oracle Relational

· Expertise skills in using the tools  SQL *Loader, Oracle SQL Developer and Oracle utilities like  UTL FILE, External Table .

· Supported Advance PL/SQL using Cursor, REF Cursor.
· Experience in application development using various advanced features of Oracle like Bulk Collections, Collections, Autonomous Transactions, Dynamic SQL and Records.
· Experience in Performance Tuning using Hints, Indexes, Explain Plan .
· Extensively worked on Table Partitioning, Bulk Binds and Bulk Collects.
· Practical understanding of the Data modeling (logical and physical) 
· Extensively worked on developing and modifying UNIX/LINUX Shell Scripts.
· Strong interpersonal skills, ability to interact with people at all levels.
· Ability to work individually as well as in a team with excellent problem solving and troubleshooting capabilities. Able to explain technical concepts and communicate with users and system administrators at all levels.

Projects Details:
Client company: BNY Mellon Bank, Newyork
The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation, doing business as BNY Mellon, is an American worldwide banking and financial services holding company headquartered in New York City. The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation, incorporated on February 9, 2007, is a global investments company. The Company is focused on helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. It provides financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors. BNY Mellon provides a comprehensive range of investment services that are unrivalled in scale, precision and quality.

PROJECT PROFILE 

#1 Sales & Expense Tool: 
Client: Mercedes Benz South Korea, Turkey, Mexico, Romania, Thailand, Australia
Duration: Sep 2017 till Date. 
Software Environment: SQL, DB2. 
Team Size: 5 
Database: DB2 9.7, DB2 11.1, MS SQL Server
 
Description: It handles Contract which is being sold on vehicles. Through this system one can create product associate it with some model of the vehicle and bound it with multiple products. Once the product is created dealer or user can sell contracts through this system. It handles many action items on contracts like view, cancel, refund on cancel or reject, reject of a contract.

#2 PERFORMANCE EVALUATION TOOL: 
Client: Mercedes Benz China, Australia. 
Duration: 2017 Feb till Dec 2017. 
Software Environment: SQL, DB2. 
Team Size: 5 
Description: In system you can track monthly sales and Expense of vehicle as well as contracts sold in the market. Show performance of KPI's on segregate level like part per cost, part per damage, cost per visit. System can track performance of dealer, region and package level data. Show which damage cost or package incur more loss and more revenue to their market. 

#3 Financial Reporting & Forecasting Tool: 
Client: Mercedes Benz China, Australia, Thailand, South Korea 
Duration: 2017 Dec till Apr 2018. 
Software Environment: SQL, DB2. 
Team Size: 4 
Database: DB2 9.7, DB2 10.5 Module: Service Contract. 
 
Description: Service Contract Financial Reporting is a report generated monthly which gives the information of overall Revenue generated and expenses incurred corresponding to all the contracts sold in the market.

· Created Schema, Users, Tables, Constraints, Indexes, Triggers, Privileges, Roles, Cursors, Ref Cursors, User Profiles, anonymous blocks, directories, sequences, packages and synonyms.

Projects:-   1. BI – Implementation 
   
· Specialize in BI Data warehouse implementation & operation.

· Working knowledge Telecom Network elements and source systems.

    Responsibilities:- 
                
· Developed the DataStage jobs for integrating the files into Oracle database.
· Prepared the shell scripts to manage the source files and moved to DataStage input location.
· Prepared the Job sequences for running the jobs sequentially, and scheduled in the DS jobs in the Job Scheduling Console Tool (Tivoli).
· Prepared the DDL for creating the table from test to production database get it implemented through raising the RFC in remedy tool.
· File level testing on Unix platform.
· Data loading jobs monitoring through DataStag tool.
· Ensuring accuracy and timeliness in data loading and cognos report generating. Coordinating with circle-IT and Intelligence Network Teams Making Reconciliation scripts for daily activities.


         2. IRIS (Improved Revenue through Intelligence Segmentation)

· When call rate is very low & approximately consistent for all type of calls, Revenue increment is one of the major challenges for every telecom. To overcome this problem we designed IRIS (Improve Revenue with Intelligence Segmentation) application. Through subscriber CDR (Call Details Record) behaviour we analyse& fire test promo accordingly. Tracking of their promo related revenue, we compare before & after ROI (Revenue On-Investment) & identify whether this promo is beneficial or not & then after we launch that promo broadly.


Industrial Exposure:- 

· Completed 4 weeks summer training in embedded system (using 8051) from Cetpa, Roorkee.
· Completed 3 months Internship from Continental Automotive Components pvt. Ltd, Gurgaon.
· Completed 6 month project in Electronic Eye Control Security System in 8th semester.

ACADEMIC PROJECT

•	Title: Larceny protection via vehicle tracking system UsingGPS Module and GSM Modem.
•	Technology: Embedded System
•	Team Size: 4
•	Responsibilities: Study of GPS and GSM as well as the ongoing research over this also done hardware implementation.
•	Description:  This project provides real-time location of a vehicle and also report theft via SMS to the client and alternatively the tracking server. The GPS reads the current coordinates of the vehicle and the data is sent to client via GSM network using the GSM modem. It uses an Arduino which is an open source physical computing platform based on a simple input/output (I/O) board and a development environment that implements the Processing language.
